src_text: Tshedimosetso ya Se weng ya Mogare wa Corona (COVID-19) Mo puong ya gagwe ya se weng ka Laboraro, 16 Lwetse 2020, Moporesitente Cyril Ramaphosa o itsisitse fa naga e tla tsena mo Kgatong ya Ntlha ya dikgato tsa go sekega nakwana ditiro tsa ka fa nageng go tloga ka Mosupologo, 21 Lwetse 2020.
trg_text: Update on the Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) In his address to the nation on Wednesday, 16 September 2020, President Cyril Ramaphosa announced the move to Alert Level 1 of the national lockdown with effect from Monday, 21 September 2020.

src_text: Melawanataolo e ment hwa eno e repisitse melaokiletso e e rileng e e tsentsweng tirisong fa e sale ka Mopitlwe 2020 eo maitlhomo a yona e neng e le go thibela go anama ga mogare on Yona, gare ga e mengwe, e tsenyeletsa ya kiletso ya go kgobokana ga batho, mo meketeng le mo masong, mmogo le go bulwa ga melelwane go etela dinaga tsa ka fa Aforika le tsa bodit habat haba, go tloga ka la bo 1 Diphalane 2024.
trg_text: The new regulations eased certain restrictions implemented since March 2020 to prevent the spread of the viru They include, amongst others, the permissible number of people at public gatherings, events and funerals, as well as the opening of borders for travel within Africa and internationally, effective from 1 October 2020.Cabinet has encouraged further engagement with the traditional leadership to address issues related to initiation schools and practices, which are still prohibited during Alert Level 1.

src_text: Kabinete e rotloetsa gore go nne le ditherisano tse dingwe gape le baeteledipele ba merero ya setso go sekaseka dintlha tse di amanang le merero ya bogwera le bojale tse le jaanong di santseng di ileditswe mo Kgatong ya Ntlh Tshedimosetso e e tseneletseng mabapi le melawanataolo e e phasaladitsweng mo kaseteng e ka fitlhelwa mo webesaeteng ya puso ya wwgoza Kabinete e ikuela mo baaging botlhe ba naga ya Aforika Borwa gore ba tswelele go obamela dikgato tsa boitekanelo tsa mabapi le COVID-19 tse di jaaka go katogana, go apara dimaseke fa re le fa gare ga batho le go tlhapa diatla ka gale ka metsi a sesepa kgotsa go itlotsa ka sebolayamegare se se nang le alekhohol Kabinete e rotloetsa baagi go taonelouta epe ya megala ya seatla ya COVID Alert South Africa mo go Apple App Store kgotsa mo go Google Play Stor Epe eno
trg_text: More information on the gazetted regulations is accessible on the government website (wwgoza).Cabinet urges all people in South Africa to continue observing the COVID-19 health protocols such as maintaining social distancing, wearing a mask in public and regularly washing hands with soap and water or using an alcohol-based hand sanitiseCabinet also encourages the public to download the COVID Alert mobile app from the Apple App Store or Google Play Stor The app

src_text: e tla tokafatsa dikgato tsa go gata motlhala batho ba ba kileng ba kopana le ba ba lwalang ba go totobaditsweng ba na le COVID-19 mo matsatsing a le 14 a a fetilen Epe eno ga e bokeletse tshedimosetso ka ope kgotsa go gata ope motlhala gongwe le gongwe ko a yang Tirisodikgoka e e Totileng Batho ba Bong jo bo Rileng le Dipolao tsa Basadi (GBVF) Kabinete e tswelela ka maikemisetso a yona a go lwantshana le leru le lentsho la GBVF ka go gagamatsa maphata a Setlhopha sa Tshireletsego; ka go tokafatsa matlhomeso a molao; mmogo le go tlamela ka tshegetso ya tsa monagano le manaane a thotloetso mo baagin

src_text: Go ya ka tshedimosetso e e leng mo diatleng tsa yona go tswa kwa Tirelong ya Sepodisi sa Aforika Borwa (SAPS), ka bomadimabe puso e nopotse mafelo a le 30 a GBVF e ntshitseng ga tshwene mo go ona go ralala le nag Kabinete e netefaleditse baagi ba mo mafelong ano gore ka go tshwarisana tiro eno le sepodisi, dikgato tsa tsereganyo di tla gagamadiwa go tlhomamisa gore basadi le bana ba a babalesega le go sireletseg Kabinete e amogetse e bile e leboga koleke ya bokanaka R50-milione go tswa kwa United Kingdom e e tla tshegetsang matsapa a a tsweletseng a Letlole la Tshwaraganelo go samagana le matsapa a ikonomi a a tlhodilweng ke leroborobo la COVID-19.
trg_text: Based on data obtained through the South African Police Service (SAPS), government has sadly identified 30 GBVF hotspots around the countr Cabinet has assured the affected communities that working with the police, intervention measures will be strengthened to ensure the protection and safety of women and childreCabinet has welcomed and appreciated the R50-million donation from the United Kingdom which will extend the Solidarity Fund s ongoing efforts to counter the economic devastation caused by the COVID-19 pandemi The funds will focus on projects that support and promote womeCabinet also expressed concern at disturbing reports of human-trafficking incidences involving women and children in the countr Police are following up and investigating all reported cases related to human and drug traffickinCabinet appeals to the public to report these heinous crimes to the police immediately instead of using social media platforms, which makes it difficult for law-enforcement agencies to respond quickly and adequatel The public is again cautioned to refrain from peddling fake news, which may cause unnecessary panic, inflame emotions and incite violence in our societAnyone with information should contact the SAPS on the Crime Stop number 08600 10111 or use the free MySAPS Application, which can be downloaded on any iPhone or smartphone Destruction and theft of public infrastructureCabinet welcomes the recent arrests of suspects in Johannesburg and Cape Town involved in stealing copper cables and train signal cable Police also acted swiftly in arresting people involved in the destruction of the main road in Msinga, KwaZulu-Nata Cabinet commends this breakthrough made by the police on the theft and vandalizing of the rail infrastructure; a serious crime which resulted in some instances in the loss of innocent lives due to train collusion Public infrastructure remains the cornerstone of driving our econom It remains a critical component in our drive to grow the economy and create the much-needed job Cabinet calls on all South Africans to report these criminal activities to the policeSouth African Social Security Agency (SASSA) online serviceCabinet welcomed the launch of the online grant application portal by the SASSA, which enables applications to be lodged on https://servicesassgoz The portal

src_text: Matlole ano a tla dirisiwa mo diporojekeng tse di tshegetsang le go tsholetsa serodumo sa basad Kabinete gape e tlhagisitse matshwenyego a yona ka dipegelo tse di tlhobaetsang tse di ka ga ditiragalo tsa go utswiwa ga batho ka fa nageng moo go amegang basadi le ban Sepodisi se mo motlhaleng wa ditiragalo tseno e bile se batlisisa dikgetse tsotlhe tse di butsweng tse di amanang le dipegelo tsa go utswiwa ga batho le tsa go rekisa diritibatsi go se mo molaon Kabinete e ikuela mo baaging go bega ditiragalo tse di setlhogo tseno tsa bosenyi kwa sepodising ka ponyo ya leitlho go na le gore ba dirise mafaratlhatlha a ditlhaeletsano, e leng seo se dirang gore go nne boima mo ditheo tsa go disa kobamelomolao go tsibogela dikgetse tseno ka bonako le ka tshwanel Baagi ba kgalemelwa gape le gore ba se phasalatse dikgang tsa maaka, tse di ka dirang gore batho ba tshelele mo letshogong go sa tlhokagale, ba dira gore go nne le t hakgalo e e seng kana ka sepe le go tlhola merusu mo metseng ya ron Motho mang le mang yo a nang le tshedimosetso a ka ikgolaganya le SAPS mo nomorong ya Crime Stop e e reng 08600 10111 kgotsa a dirisa epe e e sa duelelweng ya MySAPS Application, e e ka taoneloutiwang ka mogala mongwe le mongwe wa mo seatleng wa iPhone kgotsa wa thekenoloji ya se weng Go Sengwa le go Utswiwa ga Mafaratlhatlha a Set haba Kabinete e neseditse pula ditiragalo tsa se weng tsa go tshwarwa ga babelaelwa kwa Johannesburg le kwa Motsekapa ba ba amegang mo go utswiweng ga megala ya motlakase ya koporo mmogo le e e tsamaisang diteren Sepodisi gape se diretse ka bonako mo go tshwareng batho ba ba amegang mo go senyeng mmilamogolo wa kwa Msinga, KwaZulu-Nata
trg_text: Presidential Commission on the Fourth Industrial Revolution (PC4IR) ReportCabinet approved the publication of the PC4IR Report in the Government Gazett The report makes proposals to reinvigorate the country s industrialisation aspirations and improve our global and continental economic competiveness to enhance inclusive growtKey drivers of the PC4IR Strategy include economic competiveness, responding to service delivery challenges, human capacity investment and responding to COVID-19.This gives effect to the 2018 State of the Nation Address, which directed that a Digital Industrial Revolution Commission would respond to rapid technological advances and ensure the nation s prosperity Transport Month 2020 CampaignCabinet approved the 2020 October Transport Month campaign programme under the theme:

src_text: Kabinete e akgola tiro eno e e dirilweng ke sepodisi mabapi le go utswiwa le go senngwa ga mafaratlhatlha a diterene; e leng bosenyi jo bogolo jo bo tlhodileng gore batho bangwe ba ba senang molato ba lobe matshelo a bona ka ntlha ya dikotsi tsa go sugagana ga diteren Mafaratlhatlha a set haba a santse a le botlhokwa mo go tsamaiseng ikonomi ya ron E santse e le karolo ya botlhokwa mo thulaganyong ya rona ya go godisa ikonomi le ya go tlhola ditiro tse di tlhokagalang that Kabinete e ikuela mo go maAforika Borwa otlhe go bega ditiragalo tseno kwa sepodiseng Ditirelo tsa mo Inthaneteng tsa Setheo sa Tshireletso ya Loago sa Aforika Borwa (SASSA) Kabinete e neseditse pula kgato ya go thankgololwa ga webesaete ya ditirelo tsa go dira dikopo tsa madithuso mo inthaneteng ya SASSA, e leng seo se kgontshang batho go dira dikopo ka inthanete mo go https://servicesassgoz Webesaete eno

src_text: ke kgato eo e tla thusang bao ba tlhokang go dira dikopo gore ba boloke madi a dipalangwa le go efoga go fola mela e meleel Kabinete e rotloetsa badiradikopo ba e leng gona ba simololang go dirisa mofama ono wa go itirela kopo ka bo bona go o samela ka ntlha ya gore o fokotsa dikotsi tsa go fetelwa ke COVID-19 jaaka go diragala mo mafelong a a nyeumang ka batho Kopanokakaretso ya Kokoano ya Dinagakopano (UNGA) Moporesitente Ramaphosa o tsere karolo mo Dingangisanong tsa UNGA tsa Mafaratlhatlha a Ditlhaeletsano tsa Dibidio tsa Kopano ya bo 75 ya UNGA ka Labobedi, 22 Lwetse 2020 ka moono yo o reng:

src_text: Aforika Borwa e tla goga kwa pele UNSC lekgetlo la bobedi ka kgwedi ya Sedimonthole 2020 jaaka e tla bo e konosetsa paka ya yona ya boraro e le tokololo e e tlhophilweng go nna mo UNSC Kopano ya G20 ya Mafapha a Kgwebisano le Dipeeletso Kabinete e neseditse pula dipoelo tsa Kopano ya G20 ya Mafapha a Kgwebisano le Dipeeletso e e neng e tshwerwe le naga ya Saudi Arabia ka Mafaratlhatlha a Ditlhaeletsano tsa Dibidio ka Labobedi, 22 Lwetse 2020.
trg_text: The meeting brought together Trade Ministers from key economies, including the United States, China, Japan, India, Brazil and German South Africa was represented by Trade, Industry and Competition Minister Ebrahim PateIn its statement, the meeting outlined the importance of economic diversification, which lays the basis for support to build the country s domestic manufacturing capabilities in critical sectors, including pharmaceuticals and fooThe meeting also supported measures to promote women s economic empowerment and micro, small and medium enterprises and recognised the risks of illicit trade Southern African Customs Union (SACU) Council of Ministers MeetingCabinet welcomed the outcomes of the SACU Council of Ministers Meeting held on Monday, 21 September 2020.

src_text: Kopano eno e kopantse ditona tsa mafapha a kgwebisano mo ditheong tse dikgolo tsa ikonomi tse di botlhokwa tse di tsenyeletsang tsa Amerika, China, Japan, India, Brazil le German Aforika Borwa e ne e emetswe ke Letona la Lefapha la Kgwebisano, Intaseteri le Dikgaisano tsa Dikgwebo Ebrahim Pate Mo puong ya yona, kopano eno e tlhalositse botlhokwa jwa go phasalatsa ditiragalo tsa ikonomi, e leng seo se tlhomang metheo ya tshegetso mo go tla agelelwang bokgoni jwa naga go itlhagisetsa ka boyona mo makaleng a a botlhokwa, go tsenyeletsa a melemo le dij Kopano eno gape e tshegeditse le dikgato tsa go tsholetsa matlafatso ya basadi mo ikonoming mmogo le dikgwebokgolo, dikgwebopotlana le dikgwebo tsa mo magareng mmogo le go sekegela tsebe selelo sa dikotsi tsa dikgwebo tse di seng mo molaong Lekgotla la Ditona tsa Mokgatlho wa Dinaga tsa Borwa jwa Aforika wa Dithoto tsa Lekgetho (SACU) Kabinete e neseditse pula dipoelo tsa Kopano ya Lekgotla la Ditona tsa SACU e e neng e tshwerwe ka Mosupologo, 21 Lwetse 2020.
trg_text: Finance and Trade Ministers from Namibia, Botswana, Eswatini, Lesotho and South Africa attended the meeting, which was chaired by Finance Minister Tito Mboweni and South Africa was represented by Minister PateThe council considered the role of SACU in the context of the new African Continental Free Trade Agreemen It resolved that the future work of the council will focus on building and developing SACU countries into a stronger manufacturing and innovation hub that can provide goods and services across the continen CABINET DECISIONS1.

src_text: Ditona tsa Matlole le Kgwebisano go tswa kwa Namibia, Botswana, Eswatini, Lesotho le Aforika Borwa di ne di tsenetse kopano eno, e monnasetulo wa yona e neng e le Tona ya Matlole Tito Mboweni mme naga ya Aforika Borwa e ne e emetswe ke Tona Pate Lekgotla leno le sekasekile botlhokwa jwa SACU mo go samaganeng le Tumelano ya Kgwebisano e e Senang Dikgoreletsi mo Dinageng tsa Kontinente ya Aforik E tsere tshwetso ya gore tiro e e tla diriwang ke lekgotla leno mo nakong e e tlang e tla tsepamisa mogopolo mo go ageng dinaga tsa SACU tse di tlhabologang gore di nne mafelo a magolo a tlhagisodikuno le motswedi wa boitshimololedi gore di kgone go tlamela kontinente yotlhe ka ditlhagisiwa le ditirel Ditshwetso tsa Kabinete1.

src_text: Pegelo ya Khomi ene ya Moporesitente e e ka ga Merero ya Phetogo ya Intaseteri e e ka ga Thekenoloji (PC4IR) Kabinete e neseditse pula kgato ya go phasaladiwa ga Pegelo ya PC4IR mo Kaseteng ya Pus Pegelo eno e tshitshinya gore maikemisetso a go tsosolosa difeme tsa ka fa nageng a kgotlhokgodiwe mme go tokafadiwe kgaisano ya rona mo lefatsheng le mo kontinenteng mo mererong ya ikonomi mmogo le go tokafatsa kgolo ya ikonomi e e akaretsang botlh Dikarolo tse di botlhokwa thata mo Togamaanong ya PC4IR di tsenyeletsa dikgaisano mo mererong ya ikonomi, go tsibogela dikgwetlho tsa kabo ya ditirelo, go thapa batho mmogo le go samagana le COVID-13.
trg_text: This year s programmes will focus on three areas namely (1) developments in the transport sector, in reopening of the economy in the face of COVID-19; (2) safety in all modes of transport, and (3) transformation, empowerment and formalisation of the taxi industrThe national month-long programme will focus on the various sectors of the transport industr It will culminate in the National Taxi Lekgotla at the end of October 2020, which will consolidate inputs from the Provincial Taxi Makgotl

src_text: Seno se diragatsa se go builweng ka sona mo Puong ya Maemo a Set haba (SoNA) ya ngwaga wa 2018, mo go laetsweng gore Khomi ene ya Merero ya Phetogo ya Intaseteri e e ka ga Thekenoloji e tla rwala maikarabelo a go samagana le ditlhabololo tse di tlisiwang ke thekenoloji tse di diragalang ka bonako mmogo le go netefatsa gore naga e tswelela go atlega Letsholo la Ngwaga wa 2020 la Kgwedi ya Dipalangwa Kabinete e neseditse pula Letsholo la Ngwaga wa 2020 la Kgwedi ya Dipalangwa ka moono yo o reng:
trg_text: Correctional Services Amendment Bill of 2020Cabinet approved the submission of the Correctional Services Amendment Bill of 2020 to Parliamen The amendments are primarily in response to the Constitutional Court judgement handed down in the Phaahla Judgement on 3 May 2019.The amendments entrench the right to a fair trial as contemplated in Section 35(3)(n) of the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa of 1996 in the application of the Section 136 (1) of the Correctional Services Act, 1998 (Act 111 of 1998) SAPS Amendment Bill of 2020Cabinet approved publication of the Bill in the Government Gazette for public comment The Bill amends the SAPS Act, 1995 (Act 68 of 1995), to bring it in line with the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa of 1996 and to ensure optimal policin

src_text: Lenaneo la monongwaga le tla tsepamisa mogopolo mo dikarolong di le tharo e bong (1) tlhabololo mo lekaleng la dipalangwa fa go bulwa se wa ikonomi ya rona re ntse re tobane le COVID-19; (2) pabalesego mo mefuteng yotlhe ya dipalangwa, mmogo le, (3) phetolothefosano, matlafatso le go kwadisa semmuso intaseteri ya dithekes Lenaane leno la naga le le gogang ngwaga otlhe le tla tsepamisa mogopolo mo makaleng a a farologaneng a intaseteri ya dipalangw Le tla garela ka go ketekiwa ga Lekgotla la Naga la Dithekesi kwa bokhutlhong jwa kgwedi ya Diphalane 2020, e leng lona le le tla kgobokanyang maikutlotshwaelo a batho go tswa kwa Makgotleng a Diporofese tsa Nag

trg_text: It provides, amongst others, a legal framework in the governance of the police service and the establishment of community-based neighbourhood forum The Bill also takes into consideration the recommendations that came out of the Marikana Commission of Inquiry led by retired Judge Ian Farla UPCOMING EVENT1.

src_text: Dikarolo tse di kwalolotsweng se wa tseno di samagana bogolosegolo le katlholo ya Kgotlatshekelo ya Molaotheo e e rebotsweng mo Katlholong ya Phaahla ka la bo 3 Motsheganong 2012.
trg_text: for producing Jerusalema, the popular song featuring vocalist and songwriter Nomcebo Zikod Cabinet thanks them for bringing to the fore the country s artistic musical skills and capability, on this song that has taken the world by stor They are our official Arts and Culture Ambassadors to the Worl MESSAGES1.

src_text: Dikarolo tse di kwalolotsweng se wa di tlhoma tshwanelo ya tshekiso e e sa sekamelang ka fa letlhakoreng lengwe jaaka go tlhalositswe mo Karolong ya bo 35(3)(n) ya Molaotheo wa Rephaboliki ya Aforika Borwa wa 1996 fa go diragadiwa Karolo ya bo 136 (1) ya Molao wa Ditirelo tsa Kgopololo ya Batshwariwa wa 1998 (Molao wa bo 111 wa 1998) Molaotlhomo o o Kwalolotsweng Se wa wa SAPS wa 2020 Kabinete e neseditse pula go phasaladiwa ga Molaotlhomo ono mo Kaseteng ya Puso gore baagi ba dire ditshwael Molaotlhomo ono o kwalola se wa Molao wa SAPS wa 1995 (Molao wa bo 68 wa 1995), gore o lepalepane le Molaotheo wa Rephaboliki ya Aforika Borwa wa 1996 gore re nne le tirelo e e tswileng diatla ya bopodis
